subject: Re: [junit] the jvm does NOT shutdown
msgSnippet: not so junit oriented, but this is common when running AWT/Swing applications. if you  (or Junit) don t call System.exit() then the JVM waits for some
messageBody:
not so junit oriented, but this is common when running AWT/Swing
applications.
if you (or Junit) don't call System.exit() then the JVM waits for some
(possibly event loop) thread to finnish.

maybe someone can tell you if this is the problem here?

~mats
